result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen Lawrence Ambeau

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephen Lawrence Ambeau appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Stephen Lawrence Ambeau.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Cases adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 27, 2022; received and filed.
Defense Demand for Discovery and Inspection; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Stephen Lawrence Ambeau appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Stephen Lawrence Ambeau.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense has NOT received discovery material the previous counsel. Defense advised the Court of possible Global Resolution. State will provide Defense with Discovery materials. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated September 22, 2022; received and filed.
Signed and filed.

Defendant Stephen Lawrence Ambeau in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court as a friend of the court for Stephen Lawrence Ambeau. 
The court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour as to this matter and pending matter 22CF4159. The defendant is not required to reimburse Milwaukee County. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Branch 36 is open to accepting this matter for a possible global resolution. Case remains calendared for a status conference on September 23, 2022 at 10:15am.
ORDER GRANTING MOTION TO WITHDRAW AS COUNSEL OF RECORD; signed and filed.

Defendant Stephen Lawrence Ambeau appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Paul Alberti appeared by video for Stephen Lawrence Ambeau.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Motion to Withdraw hearing. Court reviewed Defense Motion to Withdraw. Discussions placed on the record. Court held colloquy with Defendant. State took no position. Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Withdraw as Counsel. Court advised Defendant to contact the Public Defender's Office to be evaluated for representation. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. Court VACATED Jury Trial date. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defense contacted the Court and State via email to schedule Motion to Withdraw hearing. 
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:15am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
-received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated July 1, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Stephen Lawrence Ambeau in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
 Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense counsel requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Jury Trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Stephen Lawrence Ambeau in court with attorney Tyler Jochman on behalf of Thomas Paul Alberti.  Owen Piotrowski on behalf of William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated May 26, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Stephen Lawrence Ambeau in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti appear in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. State to provide Defense counsel with discovery material and an offer via digital system. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated May 12, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Stephen Lawrence Ambeau in court with Attorney Tyler Jochman; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Jochman is in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated March 31, 2022; received and filed.
Defense Motion to Adjourn Preliminary hearing; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

-received and filed.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision LEVEL 5. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Court ordered no contact with TPA and EEB. 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Stephen Lawrence Ambeau in court with attorney Tyler A Jochman.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/16/22 @ 2p
